item.title: CoD Warzone: Area 99 Resurgence Easter Egg Guide
item.description:
A hidden Easter Egg has been discovered on the Resurgence Area 99 map in Call of Duty: Warzone , adding an extra challenge for players beyond just surviving. By completing a series of in-game tasks, players can unlock an exclusive animation as a reward.

Continuing Call of Duty ’s long-standing tradition of secret Easter Eggs, Area 99 joins the list of maps featuring hidden challenges for players to uncover. Easter Eggs have been a core part of the franchise since its initial release, offering additional goals across Zombies, Multiplayer, and Warzone . Here’s a step-by-step guide on how to complete the Area 99 Easter Egg in Warzone .

How To Complete The Warzone Area 99 Easter Egg

Shoot Off 12 Dressed Mannequin Heads

To complete the Area 99 Easter Egg in Call of Duty: Warzone , players must shoot the heads of 12 dressed mannequins as quickly as possible at the Mannequin Assembly POI . The easiest way to accomplish this is by teaming up with friends to spread out across the POI and count out loud how many mannequins each player has taken down. If done correctly, a sound will confirm completion. While this Easter Egg can be completed solo, it requires luck with mannequin placement and minimal competition when landing at the POI.

The Mannequin Assembly area contains 24 mannequins, but only 12 will spawn in random locations each match. To maximize efficiency, use a map with all possible spawn points to minimize time spent searching.

If you fail to destroy the mannequins within the required time – signaled by the absence of the confirmation sound – you’ll need to start a new match and try again.

Grab the Key Cards

After successfully removing all 12 mannequins, head to the Reactor POI and locate two highlighted bodies to collect the key cards . This step, along with the next, requires two players — each must collect a key card and activate the final step simultaneously. To avoid getting stuck, make sure you have at least one teammate, as it’s not possible to pick up both key cards alone.

Launch the Nukes in Area 99

Once you have both key cards, head to the Test Site POI and enter the terminal building located next to the UAV Tower. In the Test Site's mission control , you and the second key card holder will need to launch the nukes simultaneously to complete the process.

Warzone's Area 99 Nuke Easter Egg was discovered by players Dawg130, PassivePuppet, WATTS52621013, Marty, and JoeyCleaves, who shared the full process and steps to complete it on Twitter.

Unfortunately, this Easter Egg only triggers the animated in-game sequence of nukes detonating in Area 99 and does not provide any usable in-game rewards or cosmetic items. It’s unclear whether any hidden rewards exist, but upon completion, nothing is automatically granted, unlike other Easter Eggs in the game.

item.title: Tekken 8 Making Changes to Controversial Season 2 Plans After Community Feedback
item.description:
Summary

  • Bandai Namco announced that the chip damage change to throw breaks in Tekken 8 Season 2 is not permanent after community feedback.
  • An update is planned to release before Tekken World Tour 2025 in May to remove chip damage on throw breaks.
  • The input window for throw breaking will also be loosened in Season 2 of Tekken 8.

Bandai Namco announced that the controversial throw break and chip damage changes for Tekken 8 Season 2 will not be permanent after the development team gauged community feedback. Another new change to throw breaks was announced for Season 2 of Tekken 8 , and Bandai Namco outlined the adjustments that will be made soon.

The Tekken Talk Live livestream on March 23 outlined Tekken 8 DLC character Anna Williams and the gameplay adjustments that will be made with the Season 2 update on March 31. During the stream, Tekken 8 director Katsuhiro Harada revealed one of the most controversial gameplay changes in Tekken 8's history thus far. Harada revealed that throw breaks will deal chip damage to the player who successfully negates the throw in Tekken 8 Season 2, and fans of the game were frustrated about the ramifications of that change on competitive play. The divisive change means players will be punished for being defensive, since damage is still incurred when breaking out of throws.

Bandai Namco released its balance overview with a list of changes for Tekken 8 Season 2 patch 2.0, revealing that Tekken 8's controversial throw breaks change will be scrapped in a future update. In a subsequent update, throw breaks will no longer deal chip damage to the player, and the thrower will receive one point of recoverable health for initiating the throw. According to the developers, they received feedback from players and reconsidered the inclusion of chip damage, concluding that the change imposed an excessive disadvantage on the defending player breaking out of the throw. The developers reiterate that throw breaking is a high-skill mechanic that reflects the player's skill in Tekken 8 .

Tekken 8 Will Remove Controversial Chip Damage for Breaking Throws in a Future Update During Season 2

Moreover, the input window for throw breaking will be loosened, allowing players to more easily break throws in Tekken 8 Season 2. This helpful change will be applied directly when the Season 2 update launches on March 31, but the chip damage will be removed at a later date in an upcoming update. The Tekken 8 developers note that the update and its adjustments are scheduled to be completed before the opening of Tekken World Tour 2025 on May 9.

The chip damage update is part of the Tekken 8 Season 2 roadmap, which includes a special Pac-Man 45th anniversary stage, free Atelier Yumia collaboration DLC, and returning DLC characters. Tekken 8 Season 2 is expected to last through the entirety of 2025, and the season's final DLC character and stage are planned to release in winter 2025. During Season 2, Tekken 8 is one of the main titles for EVO 2025, and the game's meta will likely change in the coming months as more character balance updates are introduced and more DLC characters are released.

item.title: 8 Classic Era Assassin's Creed Games That Have Aged The Best, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Classic Assassin's Creed games starring Ezio, like Revelations & Brotherhood, have aged well.
  • Assassin's Creed Rogue offers a unique experience by allowing players to be on the Templar side.
  • Assassin's Creed 2 remains unforgettable and the best classic game of the franchise.

Assassin's Creed has been a long-running franchise that has evolved over the years, giving players new stories in new areas of history. However, even with the games progressing to places like Japan with Assassin's Creed Shadows , some players are still enjoying the Assassin's Creed games from the classic era of the franchise.

From experiencing the Creed as Ezio Auditore in Italy, to becoming a Pirate like Edward Kenway, these classic titles don't only have great stories, but have also aged the best to allow players to still enjoy them many years after their release. These are by far the classic Assassin's Creed games that have aged the best, ranked.

8 Assassin's Creed Revelations

A Well-Deserved End To Ezio's Story

The classic games of Assassin's Creed wouldn't be classics if it didn't include the fans of the franchise's favorite assassin, Ezio Auditore. With this Italian Assassin having multiple games involving him, every single one has been a great experience to replay for players, especially as they still hold their ground, even today.

Assassin's Creed Revelations may be the weakest of these, but it's still a great game to play by Ubisoft, as well as being a brilliant conclusion to the story of Ezio and finally allowing the franchise to move on to another character.

7 Assassin's Creed Rogue

An Assassin's Creed Story From The Opposite Side

Out of the multiple previous games in the Assassin's Creed franchise, some of the spin-off games that have been created alongside the main franchise have been just as great to play again, aging well with their fellow Assassin's Creed titles. Assassin's Creed Rogue is an interesting addition to the franchise, as it's the only game where players are on the opposite side of the conflict between the Assassins and the Templars.

Playing as Shay Cormac, an assassin that has swapped sides, combines the gameplay of Assassin's Creed Black Flag – which will be mentioned later – with this entirely new story to create a classic experience that many players have enjoyed replaying when hoping for another Templar title.

6 Assassin's Creed 3

A Great Exploration Of Colonial America

Alternatively, players have also been replaying Assassin's Creed 3 . Although there had been more than three games before it, Assassin's Creed 3 took players to an entirely different period of history as they got to explore Colonial America as a Native American man.

Although Assassin's Creed 3 did have some issues, such as players finding this open-world and parts of the story to be quite weak, the game played brilliantly back in the day, with players still enjoying the gameplay of this title when exploring as Connor.

5 Assassin's Creed Syndicate

Players Get To Be Two Whole Assassins

Assassin's Creed Shadows uses a feature that has rarely been used in other games in the franchise, as players can freely swap between the two main characters of the title. Before this, the first game to allow players this sort of exploration in the story was Assassin's Creed Syndicate .

Set during the industrialization of London, playing as the Frye twins brought a whole new breath of life to the franchise. With Jacob being better suited for less sneaky activities, Assassin's Creed Syndicate also added potentially new gameplay that continues to be entertaining to return to every once in a while.

4 Assassin's Creed Unity

The Assassin's Creed Game With The Best Parkour

The unfortunate problem with Assassin's Creed Unity was the technical issues it faced on its release. This aside, Unity is by far one of the greatest classic era Assassin's Creed games that players have enjoyed returning to due to its incredible parkour mechanics that many players claim the modern titles have not been able to recreate.

Thanks to multiple post-release patches, Assassin's Creed Unity was transformed into one of the best classic era games of the franchise, with players adoring both the missions and the world of the French Revolution they could freely explore.

3 Assassin's Creed Brotherhood

Introduced One Of The Best Systems In The Franchise

Out of all the classic Assassin's Creed games to be released, another highly loved entry from the games that covers the life of Ezio is Assassin's Creed Brotherhood . While Assassin's Creed 2 is adored for introducing many players to the franchise, Brotherhood is adored for bringing plenty of new features to the game that many players can't live without.

A staple of the game was the recruitment mechanic that allowed players to acquire more assassins and then use them in combat. With the game following directly the events of the second Assassin's Creed title, this game does what Assassin's Creed 2 did, but better to make an experience players have happily returned to.

2 Assassin's Creed 4: Black Flag

Still One Of The Greatest Pirate Adventures

As previously discussed, besides Ezio being a staple of the franchise that many players miss, besides the adventures in Italy, players also adored the classic title of Assassin's Creed Black Flag, where players weren't a regular assassin but instead an infamous pirate in the Caribbean.

The open-world of this game was so much better than the others, with the game also introducing players to ship combat. To captain their own vessel, the player would have to fight off other pirates, Templars, or even start their own battles with merchant vessels. While Assassin's Creed Odyssey may have ship combat, the story can't rival Edward Kenway.

1 Assassin's Creed 2

A Game And Protagonist That Shall Never Be Forgotten

Unsurprisingly, Assassin's Creed 2 stands out as one of the classic Assassin's Creed games that has aged the best over the years. Even with so many other games coming after it, including titles that involved more of Ezio's story as seen, none will ever be at the same level as Assassin's Creed 2 .

Since its original release in 2009, Assassin's Creed 2 has been re-released on multiple platforms to allow players to continue to enjoy the first story of Ezio, which some players even rank higher than the original Assassin's Creed game, besides how well this one plays.

item.title: How Dark Mass’ Underwater Experience Brings Horror to a New Level
item.description:
Looking to join the list of unique immersive survival horror games, Dark Mass is an upcoming title developed by the Spanish-based studio Path Games. Dark Mass invites players to a fully underwater first-person eerie adventure. Fans will play from the perspective of Alice, a deep-sea explorer who finds a sunken manor where a stalking dark presence lurks.

In Dark Mass , players will have to solve disturbing puzzles based on historical torture methods while struggling to deal with enemies, darkness, and moral decisions that will affect Alice’s fate. Because the story of Dark Mass is almost entirely sub-aquatic, the development team at Path Studio had to carefully approach fears like thalassophobia, which is the fear of drowning in deep waters, and claustrophobia. Game Rant recently spoke with Path Games co-founders and Dark Mass developers Virginia Calvo and Gonzalo G. Luna about what it meant for the team to create a sinister underwater world.

How Path Games Pushed the Boundaries of Deep Sea Phobias in Dark Mass

According to Calvo and Luna, most immersive horror games work in a horizontal plane with X and Z axes. But the team behind Dark Mass opted for a different route to enhance feelings of claustrophobia and used vertical exploration. As the developers explained,

“By introducing verticality, we pushed claustrophobia to a new level. The world isn’t just wide — it’s deep, filled with narrow passages and vertical spaces that heighten the tension.”

Another important theme in Dark Mass is thalassophobia. Calvo and Luna share that “90% of the game takes place underwater,” so they admit that players may have to step into the game with their fear of drowning somewhat tamed. However, the developers detail that Dark Mass seeks to balance eeriness without giving a frustrating experience.

For example, one of Dark Mass ’ major gameplay elements is the walkie-talkie system. While exploring, Alice will communicate with her brother Reed, who can advise Alice with puzzles and decision-making. However, Calvo and Luna add that the walkie-talkie not only enhances immersion but also works as a tension-breaker that can alleviate the feeling of being isolated underwater.

The Challenges Behind Dark Mass’ Submarine World

To take the submerged experience further, the development team had to address underwater physics, and Calvo and Luna reveal that this was quite a time-consuming challenge. Still, the team paid close attention to how each object would behave so that players would feel that Dark Mass ’ world had “consistent, believable rules.” As the developers explain, horror hits harder with realism present to a certain degree. Handling realistic underwater lighting posed its own difficulties as well, since light behaves very differently under the sea:

“The deeper you go, the less light penetrates, and colors begin to fade into shades of blue and green. This creates a unique challenge when it comes to guiding the player, especially since we can’t rely on vibrant visual cues. But we’ve found workarounds using tools like the walkie-talkie and other techniques to ensure players never feel completely lost.”

Like in most horror games, sound will play a crucial role in Dark Mass ’ surrounding gameplay. Calvo and Luna share that they designed different audio layers for each environment to accompany both intense scenes and moments of calm.

When it comes to other immersive gameplay features, Dark Mass ’ decision system will lead to multiple endings. However, unlike other decision-based horror games, the developers reveal that “not all decisions are text-based” in Dark Mass . Instead, some decisions will relate to how much players have explored the manor or whether they have discovered certain items or not. On the other hand, Calvo and Luna add that replayability isn’t really a main goal for the team as much as it is that players can fully relate to their first playthrough.

Dark Mass ’ first trailer showed a particular corpse-like enemy inside the eerie manor. Calvo and Luna reveal that players can look forward to even more creatures in future trailers, as well as more interactive gameplay elements.

Dark Mass is in development for PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X/S, with a release window planned for fall 2026.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Will Fix Annoying PC Issue Soon
item.description:
Summary

  • Marvel Rivals is working on reducing high RAM consumption on the PC version.
  • Season 2 promises changes and additions, including new team-ups and playable characters.
  • Developers aim to introduce a new checkbox to reduce memory consumption in upcoming updates.

Marvel Rivals is working on a fix for the issue of high RAM consumption. Marvel Rivals is available for PC and consoles, but despite its wide success across various platforms, players have been running into a few problems. To keep the experience fair and optimized for all players, NetEase has consistently released updates aimed at fixing bugs and game balance shortcomings.

Addressing a recurring complaint from the community, Marvel Rivals March 6 update fixed a series of terrain issues that caused players to get stuck in strange areas of the maps. A few days later, the release of the March 13 patch made further fixes to various problems, like character-related bugs and the high sensitivity caused by the high frame rate, which led to strange behavior. Despite the constant fixes, one recurring problem continues to affect PC players. However, one Marvel Rivals developer offers some good news.

Lead Technical Designer Weikang Ruan confirmed that the Marvel Rivals crew is working to reduce the memory leak on the PC version. Speaking to PC Gamer at GDC 2025, Ruan revealed that Season 2 may introduce a new checkbox in the launcher, so players can use it to “significantly reduce memory consumption.” Marvel Rivals ' technical problems on PC have been happening since the shooter's launch in December 2024, causing crashes and hiccups mainly on PCs with less than 32 GB of RAM. The community has been testing alternative solutions ever since, but the problem persists without an effective solution.

Marvel Rivals Season 2 Promises Changes and Additions

Season 2 of Marvel Rivals is expected to drop on April 11, and optimization of the high RAM consumption is one of the new features that players can expect. The devs promise changes to Marvel Rivals ' team-ups, adding new special abilities and adjusting existing ones, although details are currently unknown. Additionally, a new theme will replace the current one, possibly the famous Hellfire Gala from the X-Men comics. Another change will be in the roster of playable characters, which is believed to welcome Blade and Emma Frost.

Until the second season arrives, players can enjoy other content introduced by the most recent updates. One of them is the reveal of the Venom twerk emote, which Marvel Rivals players can get for a limited time. The symbiote is also featured in the new Pick-Up bundle, with items including a skin reminiscent of his alternate look in Marvel vs Capcom . Galacta's Cosmic Adventure event continues, and players still have time to pick up other rewards, such as the new Black Widow skin.
